docs.lead_paragraph: Many Catholic colleges are pushing back against a ruling by the Obama administration that the new health care law requires insurance plans at Catholic institutions to cover birth control.

headline.seo: Law Fuels Contraception Controversy on Catholic Campuses
headline.main: Ruling on Contraception Draws Battle Lines at Catholic Colleges
headline.print_headline: Ruling on Contraception Draws Battle Lines at Catholic Colleges

docs.abstract: Many Catholic colleges are pushing back against ruling by the Obama administration that the new health care law requires insurance plans at Catholic institutions to cover birth control; Catholic Church considers it morally wrong to prevent contraception by any artificial means; rule has now run headlong into a dispute over values as Republican presidential contenders compete for the most conservative voters (Series: Political Science).
docs.snippet: Many Catholic colleges are pushing back against a ruling by the Obama administration that the new health care law requires insurance plans at Catholic institutions to cover birth control.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

keywords.value: Assn of Catholic Colleges and Universities
keywords.name: organizations
